Print No. 358. Aquatint: "A View of the American Merchant Ship Planter..."
Print No. 358. Aquatint: "A View of the American Merchant Ship Planter..."

Full title: "A View of the American Merchant Ship Planter, beating off a French National Privateer of 22 Guns July 10th 1799. The Ships fought for two Glasses and a half, when the French Privateer sheared off to repair damages, and in one Glass return'd with his Bloody Flag hoisted, with intention to Board, but was repulsed with great Slaughter â€“ The Action lasted five Glasses and a half, when the Privateer was completely Beat off." Inscribed at right under the view: "Planter, Captn. John Watts 18 Guns & 43 Men out of which 4 was Killed & Wounded." Artist and engraver not named. Published London, October 1, 1800, by John Fairburn. Companion to print of the "Constellation" capturing the French frigate "L'Insurgente", published simultaneously by John Fairburn (No. 98).
Irving S. Olds collection of naval and other historical prints and related papers
